channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-12799] Always use Schema Evolution for ACID
item.description: Always use Schema Evolution for ACID – ignore hive.exec.schema.evolution setting.
item.summary: Always use Schema Evolution for ACID

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: And, for now, turn hive.exec.schema.evolution off by default until we get more of a handle on column rename, position move, etc. For ACID however, it is a requirement.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12781096/HIVE-12799.01.patch

ERROR: -1 due to 22 failed/errored test(s), 9998 tests executed

ATTACHMENT ID: 12781721 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

Test failures are unrelated.
Committed to trunk.

Doc note: This changes the default value of hive.exec.schema.evolution to false in 2.1.0 (edit: and 2.0.1) and changes the parameter to true for ACID, which is not mentioned in the parameter description but should be documented in the wiki. HIVE-12625 adds the parameter to 1.3.0 with its new default and ACID behavior.

  • Hive Configuration Properties – Query and DDL Execution
  • Hive Transactions – Configuration

hive.exec.schema.evolution was introduced in 2.0.0 by HIVE-11981 with a default value of true.
HIVE-13178 changes the default for hive.exec.schema.evolution back to true again in 2.1.0.
